H0.text: Storms wash the pollutants, such as motor oil and gasoline that are sometimes leaked onto roads by vehicles, into lakes and rivers.

H1.text: Animals become sick from licking the pollutants on the road, which are motor oil and gasoline that are sometimes leaked onto roads by vehicles.

H2.text: Animals get stuck in motor oil and gasoline pollutants that are sometimes leaked onto roads by vehicles when they cross the road.

H3.text: Winds blow the pollutants—such as motor oil and gasoline leaked onto roads by vehicles—to the side of the road and harm the soil.

A4.text: Storm water runoff carries petroleum hydrocarbons, including motor oil and gasoline, into water bodies.

A5.text: Urban storm water runoff contains heavy metals from motor vehicles.
